page.title: 16Transport & Communications
page.content:
There is no public transport. Primary school children are taken to Caldbeck School by minibus. Coach transport is provided for the secondary age group to Caldew School, Dalston. Most people own or have access to a private car for other journeys. There is a voluntary car service which can be used for hospital appointments or visiting. The Mountain Goat minibus travels through the area from its base in Keswick during the summer season.
There is a telephone kiosk at Fellside but most homes are also connected to the telephone service. The post is delivered daily by mail van from Wigton (16km). Post boxes at Fellside and Parkend are cleared once daily. The nearest post office is at Caldbeck. Most families take the local monthly community magazine.
